channel.title: [New Coder] Login box and crown's HELP! please [SOLVED]
channel.description:
Hello, I'm fairly new to rsps coding and know very little about it, I am currently working off an 317 Allstar source with a bug fixed "Stupit's blank client" I have managed to do the majority of what I am wanting to do with this clients except the fact that I have no clue how to change the sprite for the Loginbox and Staff crowns, I am assuming this is client sided, I have checked the sprites folder for the normal "loginbox.png" and "crown1.png" etc but alas there is none. I am really lost with this any help would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks: --Alphaa
EDIT!: other questions I have are: am I able to add custom items/models/animations to this client? am I able to change the default windows border to something else?
Thanks again :D

item.title: [New Coder] Login box and crown's HELP! please [SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @Alphaa Alphaa
item.description:
@Alphaa wrote:

[quote=“Bl3nd, post:2, topic:546866”]In order to change the sprites, there may be a folder called ‘sprites’ in there. If not, go here.
This link should send you to Lin’s cache editor. Download it and load the clients cache with it, then you should be good from there.

In the question about customs, most likely you can. Search for custom tutorials and see how they are done. And for the other question, idk.[/quote]

Thanks for the reply, but I’m not quite sure how to use this cache editor? I can load up the cache just fine and all its just idk what to do from there, also I get alot of errors when starting the editor exe.

EDIT:
I’ve fixed the problem and IT WORKED thanks a million

Read full topic
item.source: [New Coder] Login box and crown's HELP! please [SOLVED]

item.title: [New Coder] Login box and crown's HELP! please [SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

In order to change the sprites, there may be a folder called ‘sprites’ in there. If not, go here.
This link should send you to Lin’s cache editor. Download it and load the clients cache with it, then you should be good from there.

In the question about customs, most likely you can. Search for custom tutorials and see how they are done. And for the other question, idk.

Read full topic
